facts.title: Avocado Spread
facts.fact: European sailors on their way to the New World used avocados in place of butter. Avocado is actually a healthy substitute for other types of fat, including butter, mayonnaise, sour cream, cheese, cream cheese, and cream.

facts.title: Avocado Varieties
facts.fact: There are more than 80 varieties of avocados. The most common is the year-round Hass avocado, whose original mother tree stood from 1926 to 2002 in California.

facts.title: Guacamole
facts.fact: What would guacamole be without avocados? On Super Bowl Sunday, Americans eat about 8 million pounds of guacamole. For Cinco de Mayo, the tally is closer to 14 million.

facts.title: Avoiding Browning Avocados
facts.fact: By brushing the fruit or guacamole with an acidic agent such as lemon, lime, vinegar or even oranges and placing the avocado or dish in an air-tight container in your refrigerator you can help delay this process. Placing the avocado seed in guacamole may help maintain the color of the guacamole because the seed reduces the amount of surface area that is exposed to air (minimizing oxidization). However, it is recommended you cover the guacamole with clear plastic wrap or place it in an air tight container if you prepare in advance and want to store in the refrigerator for a few hours.
